  • Method Details

    • drawImage

      public static void drawImage(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphicsContext, javafx.scene.image.Image image, Coord alignment, double scale)
      Draws an image scaled by the given scaling factor. If alignment coordinates are inside the scene, the drawn image is always totally inside the scene (unless it's too big)
      Parameters:
      graphicsContext - The graphics context required to draw the image
      image - The image to draw
      alignment - The point the image should be placed
      scale - The scaling factor applied to the image

    • drawImage

      public static void drawImage(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphicsContext, javafx.scene.image.Image image, Coord alignment)
      Draws an image (in its real size). If alignment coordinates are inside the scene, the drawn image is always totally inside the scene (unless it's too big)
      Parameters:
      graphicsContext - The graphics context required to draw the image
      image - The image to draw
      alignment - The point the image should be placed

    • drawFromCenterImage

      public static void drawFromCenterImage(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphicsContext, javafx.scene.image.Image image, Coord pos, double scale)
      Draws an image scaled by the given scaling factor, positioning its center at the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      graphicsContext - The graphics context required to draw the image
      image - The image to draw
      pos - The point the image's center should be placed
      scale - The scaling factor applied to the image

    • drawFromCenterImage

      public static void drawFromCenterImage(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphicsContext, javafx.scene.image.Image image, Coord pos)

    • drawFromCenterInteractiveImage

      public static javafx.scene.image.ImageView drawFromCenterInteractiveImage(javafx.scene.image.Image image, Coord pos, double scale, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onClick)
      Creates a view of an image scaled by the given scaling factor, positioning its center at the given coordinates. Also allows to assign an action when the image is clicked on.
      Parameters:
      image - The image to draw
      pos - The point the image's center should be placed
      scale - The scaling factor applied to the image
      onClick - The Handler containing the action to perform on click
      Returns:
      The view containing the desired image

    • addHoveringEffects

      public static void addHoveringEffects(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView, Coord pos, double scale, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> entered, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> exited, double hoverZoom, boolean bringToFront, int rotation)
      Makes the provided view enlarge when hovered on. Also allows additional actions when the mouse enters and exits the view.
      Parameters:
      imageView - The view that should be zoomed
      pos - The relative position of the view
      scale - The scale that has been previously applied to the view
      entered - The additional action to perform on mouse entered
      exited - The additional action to perfrom on mouse exited
      hoverZoom - The zoom ratio that will be used when enlarging the view
      bringToFront - true if the view must be brought in front of the other objects currently drawn on screen
      rotation - The rotation that was applied to the view

    • getOnMouseEnteredHandler

      private static javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> getOnMouseEnteredHandler(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView, Coord pos, double scale, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> entered, double hoverZoom, boolean bringToFront)
      Constructs the final Handler to assign when the user hover an image.
      Parameters:
      imageView - The view that should be zoomed
      pos - The relative position of the view
      scale - The scale that has been previously applied to the view
      entered - The additional action to perform on mouse entered
      hoverZoom - The zoom ratio that will be used when enlarging the view
      bringToFront - true if the view must be brought in front of the other objects currently drawn on screen
      Returns:
      The Handler that will be assigned to the view

    • getOnMouseExitedHandler

      private static javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> getOnMouseExitedHandler(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView, Coord pos, double scale, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> exited)
      Constructs the final Handler to assign when the user hover an image.
      Parameters:
      imageView - The view that should be zoomed
      pos - The relative position of the view
      scale - The scale that has been previously applied to the view
      exited - The additional action to perform on mouse exited
      Returns:
      The Handler that will be assigned to the view

    • addHoveringEffects

      public static void addHoveringEffects(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView, Coord pos, double scale, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> entered, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> exited, double hoverZoom, List<javafx.scene.Node> children, int rotation)
      Makes the provided view enlarge when hovered on. Also allows additional actions when the mouse enters and exits the view. Also applies the same zoom effect to the provided children.
      Parameters:
      imageView - The view that should be zoomed
      pos - The relative position of the view
      scale - The scale that has been previously applied to the view
      entered - The additional action to perform on mouse entered
      exited - The additional action to perfrom on mouse exited
      hoverZoom - The zoom ratio that will be used when enlarging the view
      children - The child nodes of the object to draw
      rotation - The rotation that was applied to the view

    • addHoveringEffects

      public static void addHoveringEffects(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView, Coord pos, double scale, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> entered, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> exited, double hoverZoom, boolean bringToFront)
      Makes the provided view enlarge when hovered on. Also allows additional actions when the mouse enters and exits the view.
      Parameters:
      imageView - The view that should be zoomed
      pos - The relative position of the view
      scale - The scale that has been previously applied to the view
      entered - The additional action to perform on mouse entered
      exited - The additional action to perfrom on mouse exited
      hoverZoom - The zoom ratio that will be used when enlarging the view
      bringToFront - true if the view must be brought in front of the other objects currently drawn on screen

    • addHoveringEffects

      public static void addHoveringEffects(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView, Coord pos, double scale, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> entered, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> exited, double hoverZoom, List<javafx.scene.Node> children)
      Makes the provided view enlarge when hovered on. Also allows additional actions when the mouse enters and exits the view. Also applies the same zoom effect to the provided children.
      Parameters:
      imageView - The view that should be zoomed
      pos - The relative position of the view
      scale - The scale that has been previously applied to the view
      entered - The additional action to perform on mouse entered
      exited - The additional action to perfrom on mouse exited
      hoverZoom - The zoom ratio that will be used when enlarging the view
      children - The child nodes of the object to draw

    • enterZoom

      private static javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> enterZoom(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView, Coord pos, double scale, double hoverZoom)
      Creates a Handler that enlarges the given view.
      Parameters:
      imageView - The view that should be zoomed
      pos - The relative position of the view
      scale - The scale that has been previously applied to the view
      hoverZoom - The zoom ratio that will be used when enlarging the view
      Returns:
      The handler that will be used to enlarge the view

    • getAnchor

      private static Coord getAnchor(javafx.scene.image.Image image, Coord pos, double scale)
      Gets the "anchor" of an image in the current screen of the application. (The anchor is a point for which it's true that the ratio between the position on the image, relative to the image current size is the same as the ratio between the position on the screen, relative to the screen size).
      Parameters:
      image - The Image for which to calculate the anchor
      pos - The position of the center of the image on the screen
      scale - The scale to be applied to the image (which changes its size and hence its anchor)
      Returns:
      The anchor of the image on the screen

    • exitZoom

      private static javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> exitZoom(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView, Coord pos, double scale)
      Creates a Handler that shrinks the given view.
      Parameters:
      imageView - The view that should be shrunk
      pos - The relative position of the view
      scale - The scale that has been previously applied to the view
      Returns:
      The handler that will be used to shrink the view

    • getChildrenEnteredZoom

      public static javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> getChildrenEnteredZoom(javafx.scene.image.ImageView child, Coord slot, double scale, double hoverZoom, javafx.scene.image.ImageView parentView, int rotation)
      Creates a Handler to apply a hovering zoom effect coordinated with the parent effect. ImageView version.
      Parameters:
      child - The child view
      slot - The position of the child (relative to its parent's and not scaled nor rotated)
      scale - The scale that was applied to the parent view
      hoverZoom - The zoom ratio that will be used when enlarging the view
      parentView - The parent view
      rotation - The rotation previously applied to the parent view
      Returns:
      The Handler which will be assigned to the parent to allow him to zoom his children

    • getChildrenEnteredZoom

      public static javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> getChildrenEnteredZoom(javafx.scene.image.ImageView child, Coord slot, double scale, double hoverZoom, javafx.scene.image.ImageView parentView)
      Creates a Handler to apply a hovering zoom effect coordinated with the parent effect. ImageView version.
      Parameters:
      child - The child view
      slot - The position of the child (relative to its parent's and not scaled nor rotated)
      scale - The scale that was applied to the parent view
      hoverZoom - The zoom ratio that will be used when enlarging the view
      parentView - The parent view
      Returns:
      The Handler which will be assigned to the parent to allow him to zoom his children

    • getChildrenExitedZoom

      Creates a Handler to apply a shrink effect on mouse exited coordinated with the parent effect. ImageView version.

    • addLighting

      public static void addLighting(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView, javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
      Adds lighting of the given color to the provided view
      Parameters:
      imageView - The view to apply the lighting to
      color - The color of the lighting to apply
